articles.description: Owen Farrell will miss the first two pool games at the World Cup as World Rugby successfully appeals against the decision to overturn his red card.
articles.title: Farrell banned for first two World Cup pool games

articles.description: Rachel Riley accuses Manchester United of "gaslighting" and "green lighting" abuse for their handling of the decision to part company with Mason Greenwood.
articles.title: Riley accuses Man Utd of 'gaslighting' over Greenwood

articles.description: Rangers' hopes of successive seasons in the Champions League group stages remain in the balance after a tense draw with PSV Eindhoven.
articles.title: Rangers' group hopes in balance after PSV draw

articles.description: Watch the fun scenes as Italy's Gianmarco Tamberi entertains on his way to gold in the high jump final at the World Athletics Championships.
articles.title: Watch Tamberi's antics on way to entertaining high jump gold

articles.description: Ishpreet Singh Chadha was a top shooter competitor, but his real dream was a career on the green baize.
articles.title: How esports helped a snooker player go pro

articles.description: Britain's Laura Muir finishes sixth at the World Championships in Budapest as Faith Kipyegon wins her third title.
articles.title: Muir sixth in 1500m as Kipyegon dominates

articles.description: More than 17,000 defeats, just one 52-year-old victory. What it is really like to play for the Washington Generals, the most famous, and consistent, losers in sport?
articles.title: One win, 17,000 defeats - life as a Washington General

articles.description: Ferrari team principal Frederic Vasseur says it would be "strange" to change the result of the 2008 world championship 15 years after events.
articles.title: Massa's claim to Hamilton's title 'strange' - Vasseur

articles.description: Phil Foden could be set for his biggest season yet, with the forward showing he can make the number 10 position his own at Manchester City.
articles.title: 'Wasted on wing' - Foden set for 'big season'

articles.description: PGA Tour commissioner Jay Monahan says there is an "intensity and urgency" to completing the deal with Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund.
articles.title: PGA Tour 'confident' PIF deal will be completed
